Package eu.unite.challenge.algorithms

Class DynamicProgrammingAlgoImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.unite.challenge.algorithms.AbstractProblemSolver
      • eu.unite.challenge.algorithms.DynamicProgrammingAlgoImpl
  • @Immutable
public class DynamicProgrammingAlgoImpl
extends AbstractProblemSolver
    is a pseudo-polynomial algorithm: It is polynomial time in the value W, which denotes the number of possible weights (if the weights are fractional, we can multiply them by a common factor so that they are all integers.) It works by trading space for time: A large table is used to memoize state for subproblems. For this specific problem, the parameters are such that the running time of DynamicProgrammingAlgoImpl is worse than that of BruteForceAlgoImpl, and it even uses much more RAM.

        Parameters:

        maxWeightScale - The maximum over the scale of all items, as well as maxWeight

      • findIncluded

        static java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.Integer> findIncluded​(int maxWeight,
                                                           java.util.List<Item> items,
                                                           int[] intWeights,
                                                           boolean[][] keep)
        Traverses the table generated by the dynamic programming (DP), to find indices for the solution subset.

        Algorithm: keep[i][w] is 1 if DP decides to take item i while restricting the weight to w. Therefore, we simply start at the end of the table: keep[n][W]. If it is true, we set w = W - wn. The procedure continues until i reaches 0.

        Parameters:
        maxWeight - The maximum weight of the package.
        items - The list of the items.
        intWeights - Item weights, converted to integer.
        keep - The table generated by the dynamic programming.
        Returns:
        The indices for the solution subset.
